question: How might the DOJ and FBI‚Äôs finding that there‚Äôs no credible evidence of an Epstein client list, blackmail operation, or murder‚Äîand the planned release of surveillance footage‚Äîaffect public trust in the investigation and expectations for further disclosure?

U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman announces charges against Jeffery Epstein in 2019. Photo: Stephanie Keith/Getty Images

President Trump's Justice Department and FBI have concluded they have no evidence that convicted sex offender and disgraced financierJeffrey Epsteinblackmailed powerful figures, kept a "client list" or was murdered, according to a memo detailing the findings obtained by Axios.

Why it matters:The findings represent the first time Trump's administration has officially contradicted conspiracy theories about Epstein's activities and his death ‚Äî theories that had been pushed by the FBI's top two officials before Trump appointed them to the bureau.

Zoom in:According to the memo, investigators closely examined footage of Epstein's Manhattan prison cell between around 10:40pm on Aug. 9, 2019, when Epstein was locked in his cell, and around 6:30am the next day, when he was found unresponsive.

Zoom out:As MAGA influencers, Patel and Bongino had been among the loudest voices touting Epstein conspiracy theories.

MAGA's media universeand some of its voices on Capitol Hill have expressed frustration with the Trump administration's handling of the Epstein case since February, when DOJ released a tranche of Epstein-related files that were already publicly available.

Conservative figurespanned the disclosure, saying it lacked new information.

The intrigue:When Elon Musk had a falling out with Trump last month, Musk accused the president of being "in the Epstein files."

Musk laterdeletedhis accusation and other posts on X,sayinghe "went too far."

What's next:The DOJ and FBI say in the memo that no "further disclosure" of Epstein-related material "would be appropriate or warranted."

Editor's note: This story has been corrected to say former Jeffrey Epstein lawyer David Schoen represented Donald Trump in Trump's second impeachment trial (not his first one).

Elon Musk has said an Axios report that theDepartment of Justiceand Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) had concluded there was no evidence of aJeffrey Epsteinclient list was the "final straw."

The report also said the agencies had concluded there was no credible evidence the disgraced financier and pedophile blackmailed high-profile and prominent individuals, and confirmed that surveillance footage showed Epstein had killed himself in prison.

It comes amid a renewal of the feud between billionaireTeslaCEO Musk and U.S. PresidentDonald Trump,who were political allies until recently.

The two men dramatically fell out over Trump's One Big Beautiful Bill, and a claim by Musk that Trump was not releasing the Epstein files because his name was in them. Musk later said hehad gone too far with the remark.

"So... umm... then what isGhislaine Maxwellin prison for?" Musk posted to his X platform, referring to Epstein's former girlfriend and associate who procured underage girls for him to abuse.

"Stuff like this does not improve people's faith in government."

Trump and his allies promised to release the Epstein case files in full amid suspicions of a cover-up about the latter's illicit sexual activities and the involvement of powerful people.

But delays to their release, and now the conclusion that Epstein was not blackmailing people or maintaining a related client list, have angered many Trump supporters,who expected a different outcome. Some believed he had been murdered while awaiting trial.

In February, U.S. Attorney GeneralPam Bondi, responding to a question onFox Newsabout Epstein's alleged client list, had said it was "sitting on my desk right now to review."

Musk posted a meme showing the Trump administration's evolving position on the issue, ending with: "There is no Epstein list."

"This is the final straw," Musk wrote in reply to another user of X, formerlyTwitter.

Musk earlier said he planned to forma new America Partyfor the 2026 midterms, which would target a handful of winnableSenateand House seats in an attempt to control the balance of power inCongressand break the two-party domination of U.S. politics.

"I am saddened to watchElon Muskgo completely 'off the rails,' essentially becoming a TRAIN WRECK over the past five weeks,"Trump posted to his Truth Social platformon Sunday, July 6.

"He even wants to start a Third Political Party, despite the fact that they have never succeeded in the United States - The System seems not designed for them.

"The one thing Third Parties are good for is the creation of Complete and Total DISRUPTION & CHAOS, and we have enough of that with the Radical LeftDemocrats, who have lost their confidence and their minds!"
